thread.title: Very WTF Video of Reckless Couple on Motorcycle Has Serious "Bound 2" Vibes
thread.title_full: Very WTF Video of Reckless Couple on Motorcycle Has Serious "Bound 2" Vibes | Complex

author: Trace William Cowen
title: Very WTF Video of Reckless Couple on Motorcycle Has Serious "Bound 2" Vibes
text:
Very WTF Video of Reckless Couple on Motorcycle Has Serious "Bound 2" Vibes By Trace William Cowen happy to waste more of your time here: @tracecowen
Feb 22, 2017 Share Tweet Video via Daily Mail Here's the thing: No one really knows what the hell is going on in the "Bound 2"-esque video above. The footage, according to popular motorcycle acrobatics publication Daily Mail , was filmed in Encarnacion, Paraguay. In their words, the clip shows a "young semi-naked couple" engaging in actual sex while atop the speeding bike.
The video itself, however, is noticeably short on any nudity worth writing home about. As for those sex-having allegations , they appear to stem from the unnamed daredevils' preferred seating arrangement and not from any actual sex-having caught on film. But again: who the hell really knows?
Related This Artist Reimagines Kanye West's "Bound 2" as a Children's Book 7 Reasons Why Kanye's "Bound 2" Video is a Triumph of American Cinema Hear an Unreleased Version of Kanye West's "Bound 2" The Daily Mail 's detailed report on this not-recommended-for-obvious-safety-reasons stunt adds that "police are believed to be investigating the incident." Specifically, cops "are said to be" taking a very close look at the video in an effort to identify the two adventurous individuals.
Semi-naked couple are caught having sex on the back of a moving motorcycle https://t.co/248m8vDOBU pic.twitter.com/b7lOQnhR43
â€” Daily Mail Online (@MailOnline) February 21, 2017 Despite the helmet-free methods presented in this bizarre video, rocking a helmet while operating or riding a motorcycle is strongly advised by experts. "Our role is to identify ways to prevent injury and death and rigorously check what works and what does not work," Dr. Thomas Frieden, director for the CDC here in the States, said last year. "For motorcycle safety, the research shows that universal helmet laws are the most effective way to reduce the number of deaths and traumatic brain injuries that result from crashes."
Tags: News , Videos , Motorcycles , Viral Videos , WTF
